result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry nmi Correa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henry nmi Correa

TR cases reopened & dismissed; bonds moved back into this case. ($200.50 from 15TR11742, $200.50 from 15TR11743, $175.30 from 15TR11744 & $175.30 from 15TR11745)

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Jeremy Chavez.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Deft fined $100 plus costs.  Bond from traffic files to be applied - balance shall be returned to poster.  Traffic files (15TR11742/43/44/45) - reopened and dismissed on State's motion per plea agreement.  NOTE - deft left w/o DNA notice; Clerk Lehman mailed notice to deft

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Jeremy Chavez.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  All but $248.40 of the $1,000.00 cash bond has been forfeited to pay the fines in 15TR11742 through 15TR11745.  Court will allow the remaining $248.40 cash to be the cash bond in this case; order for forfeiture on 1/21/16 is vacated.  Status conf. 2/8/16 at 1:15.
Appearance Notice

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Clerk attempted to reach defense counsel; defense counsel stated they could appear in about an hour.  As of 11:30am, defense counsel has not appeared.  Per Court, vacate warrant and give deft new date.  FP set for 1/25/16 @ 3:45pm.  Clerk will send email to defense counsel to inform them of new date.
